security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing TypeScript coding guidelines and examples. All 46 static findings are false positives triggered by markdown code fences, documentation examples, and metadata hashes. No executable code, network calls, or risky operations exist in this skill.

content.value_statement: Code quality issues waste debugging time and cause production bugs. This skill provides comprehensive TypeScript guidelines including strict mode enforcement, type safety patterns, and anti-pattern detection.
actual_capabilities: Enforces TypeScript strict mode compliance standards
Identifies type errors and suggests proper fixes
Detects anti-patterns like any types and ts-ignore usage
Reviews custom hooks for proper typing patterns
limitations: Designed for TypeScript and React TypeScript projects only
Cannot fix runtime logic errors or business logic issues
Complex type inference issues may require manual resolution
Does not replace ESLint or automated testing

use_cases.title: Maintain Consistent Code Standards

use_cases.title: Speed Up Quality Reviews

use_cases.title: Learn TypeScript Best Practices
use_cases.description: Get guidance on proper TypeScript patterns, type safety, and avoid common beginner mistakes.

prompt_templates.title: Strict Mode Migration

output_examples.input: Check this function for quality issues
output: Line 5: Missing return type annotation - add ': ReturnType' after parameters
Line 8: Using 'any' type - replace with 'unknown' and add a type guard
Line 12: Parameter has implicit any - add explicit type annotation

output_examples.input: Review my React component for best practices
output: Props interface is missing TSDoc comments for each property
Event handler 'onClick' should use useCallback to prevent rerenders
Consider adding explicit return type to the component function

best_practices: Enable strict mode in tsconfig.json for maximum type safety
Use explicit return types on exported functions for better API documentation
Replace any types with unknown and implement proper type guards
anti_patterns: Using ts-ignore to suppress errors instead of fixing the underlying type issue
Type assertions like 'data as any' to escape the type system
Leaving implicit any types in function parameters

faq.question: Which TypeScript projects does this work with?
faq.answer: Works with any TypeScript or React TypeScript project. Best results with strict mode enabled in tsconfig.json.

faq.question: Can it fix all TypeScript errors automatically?
faq.answer: It identifies and suggests fixes for common errors. Complex type inference issues may need manual review.

faq.question: How does it work with ESLint?
faq.answer: Complements ESLint by providing additional TypeScript-specific quality checks and pattern guidance.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation-only skill that provides guidelines without storing or transmitting your code.

faq.question: What if the suggested fix does not work?
faq.answer: Each suggestion includes alternative approaches. Ask for clarification if the first solution does not apply.

faq.question: How is this different from compiler errors?
faq.answer: Goes beyond compiler errors to enforce best practices, consistent patterns, and team coding standards.
